channel.title: National Commercial Real Estate News From CoStar Group
channel.description: CoStar Group, Inc. is the leading provider of information services to commercial real estate property investors and sales professionals in the United States and United Kingdom. CoStar's suite of services offers access to the most comprehensive database of commercial real estate information and commercial property listings available in its markets.

item.title: IRS To Converters: Go REIT Ahead!
item.description:
In the equivalent of an NFL referee throwing a penalty flag and then picking it up and saying “never mind,” the IRS has notified three firms seeking to reorganize their real property holdings into new REITs that it will resume working on their conversion requests.
The three companies in the process of REIT conversions - Lamar Advertising Co., Iron Mountain Inc. and Equinix Inc. - announced that the IRS had notified each that they could continue...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: State Farm Undertakes $750 Million in Sale/Leasebacks
item.description:
The State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance Co. continues its sell off of owned real estate. The insurance company disclosed in its third quarter report to insurance regulators that it sold 24 of its facilities this month and will lease the properties back from the buyer for terms of between five to 15 years at a total lease cost of $750.1 million.
While State Farm did not disclose the buyers or addresses, Lone Star Funds is the known buyer of 23...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Fortress Selling 25% of its Senior Housing Portfolio to Pair of REITs
item.description:
Global investment manager Fortress Investment Group has found a way and has now decided the time is right to start cashing out on some of its $6.89 billion investment bet on the senior housing business at the last height of the market in early 2007.
That is when Fortress, a global alternative investment manager with nearly $55 billion of assets unuder management, acquired Holiday Retirement, one of the largest private owners and operators of independent...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: REIT Investors, Analysts Debate Potential Impact from Expected Tapering, Higher Interest Rates
item.description:
Wall Street Investors have lately turned bearish on REITs in recent months, despite continued steady improvement in the general economy and market conditions across most of the U.S. that are seen as increasingly favorable for commercial property owners, including declining vacancy and very little new construction for most property types.
The selloff of REIT shares since late May has prompted head scratching and no small degree of angst among REIT...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: 1500 Spring Garden Trades for $184.5M in Philadelphia
item.description:
A joint venture of The Nightingale Group LLC and Carlton Associates, Inc. acquired the office tower at 1500 Spring Garden St. in Philadelphia, PA from Square Mile Capital Management LLC for $184.5 million, or about $171 per square foot.
Originally built in 1947, the 12-story, 1.08 million-square-foot, 4-Star office tower was renovated in 2002. 1500 Spring Garden sits on 3.9 acres in the Market Street West submarket of Philadelphia. It features...
item.author: Justin Sumner <news@costar.com>

item.title: U.S. Lodging Looking for Boost from Rising Group Business
item.description:
While leisure and transient business travel has surged with a strengthening economy, demand in the group travel segment has lagged during the four-year U.S. lodging recovery.
Through September 2013, transient room nights have reached 23.3% of their peak pre-recession levels, while group demand is still short by 3.2%, according to Smith Travel Research.
However, a recent survey by PKF Consulting USA, LLC and the International Association of Conference...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Starwood Closes on $1.6B Mall Acquisition
item.description: Private investment firm Starwood Capital Group closed on its previously announced acquisition of a majority interest in seven regional malls across the U.S., through a controlled affiliate. Westfield Group sold the assets for $1.64 billion, or approximately $224 per square foot, and will retain a 10% common equity interest in the properties. The malls total more than 7.91 million square feet of retail space and are located in several Midwest and...
item.author: Justin Sumner <news@costar.com>

item.title: REITWorld Redux: Attendees Wary On Economy, Bullish On CRE Fundamentals
item.description: Attendance at the REITWorld conference was somewhat higher than a year ago, but the number of empty seats during this year’s various commercial real estate panel discussion may be a better gauge of the success of the annual industry conference held this year in San Francisco. "Why were there empty seats? Because people are busy upstairs in the hallways making deals -- and deals are made because people think conditions will be strengthening," noted...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Net Lease REITs: Slower Growth Ahead or Clear for Takeoff?
item.description:
The net lease investment sector has gone through an unprecedented level of merger and acquisition activity over the past two years, with much of the M&A activity driven by non-listed affiliates or other nontraded investment trusts seeking "liquidity events" by joining forces with publicly traded net lease REIT counterparts.
That M&A activity was capped by one of the largest public-to-public transactions of the year: American Realty Capital Properties...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Ensign Group Spinning Off New Health Care REIT
item.description:
The Ensign Group Inc. said it plans to separate its health care and real estate into two separate and independent publicly-traded companies.
The Mission Viejo, CA-based firm, which operates a group of skilled nursing, rehabilitative care services, home health, hospice care, assisted living and urgent care companies, will continue to provide health care services through its existing operations after spinning off CareTrust REIT Inc., which will own...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Lowered Lending Targets for Fannie and Freddie Likely Already Met
item.description:
From the looks of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac’s third quarter earnings releases, the GSEs have largely fulfilled their 2013 goals for reducing their holdings of non-agency mortgage related exposure as mandated by the Federal Housing Finance Agency, according to Lea Overby, CMBS Strategist at Nomura Securities International.
The 2013 'scorecard' released in March of this year required that the GSEs reduce their less liquid mortgage-related investments...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: CoStar's People of Note (Nov. 10 - 16)
item.description: It's time to update those contact managers with CoStar's People of Note, reporting news on significant new CRE hires and promotions. This week's issue includes the following markets: Pittsburgh, New York City, Orlando, Phoenix, Milwaukee, Greensboro/Winston-Salem, Greenville/Spartanburg, Los Angeles, Westchester/SoConn, and Tampa. PITTSBURGH Pelusi Stepping Down as HFF's CEO By Tim Trainor
item.author: Justin Sumner <news@costar.com>

item.title: Domain by Alta Sells for $121M
item.description:
Wood Partners has sold its 379-unit Domain by Alta luxury apartment community in San Diego's Spectrum Center business park. Essex Property Trust picked up the property for $121 million, or about $319,000 per unit.
The four-story, 436,912-square-foot apartment building was constructed in 2012 on 5.9 acres in the Kearny Mesa submarket, at 8795 Lightwave Ave. in San Diego, CA. The two-building property boasts a host of unit and site amenities, including...
item.author: Justin Sumner <news@costar.com>

item.title: Saks Relocating Store Out of Downtown Cincinnati
item.description: Saks Fifth Avenue signed a letter of intent to relocate its downtown Cincinnati store to The Kenwood Collection, a former regional shopping center known as Kenwood Towne Place that Phillips Edison & Co. is transforming into a major mixed-use development intended to draw shoppers from three states. The letter of intent calls for Saks to lease 80,000 square feet of retail space over two levels of the redeveloped building that fronts Interstate I...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: REITs Need To Focus On Low Leverage and High Transparency for Future Success
item.description: While in many respects the last two decades can be viewed as a "golden era" for real estate investment trusts, having grown from a total market capitalization of $32 billion in 1993 into a market force on Wall Street with a market capitalization of $675 billion and counting currently, changing conditions in the financial markets are expected to bring new challenges. Specifically, REITs that fail to adhere to good corporate governance, adopt simple...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Pelusi Stepping Down as HFF's CEO; Former Cushman CEO Rufrano Rejoins O’Connor Capital Partners as Chairman
item.description: News this week from the executive suite as one longtime CEO announces his resignation and another former CEO prepares to get back in the game. John H. Pelusi, Jr., announced he plans to step down as CEO and vice chairman of HFF, the Pittsburgh-based provider of commercial real estate and capital markets services he helped found as Holliday Fenoglio & Co. Under Pelusi, HFF has expanded to 21 offices and become a leading financial intermediary for...
item.author: Tim Trainor <news@costar.com>

item.title: Land, Homebuilders Back in Sharp Demand by Investors
item.description:
Investors see a lot of runway in front of homebuilders as they prepare for the takeoff of the residential markets recovery.
As home price appreciation has climbed over the last 12 months after the bottom fell out of the business in 2006 and ’07, many homebuilders have been expanding their land and lot holdings in the past year -- in some cases by as much as 50%.
Housing fundamentals also look better. New home inventory is tight, with limited...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Thanks For Calling! Chatham Lodging Investors Increasingly Vocal Over Demands to Sell REIT
item.description:
After rejecting an unsolicited proposal from BlueMountain Capital Management to acquire the hotel REIT and its 23 hotels, Chatham Lodging Trust (NYSE:CLDT) got a surprise caller on its third quarter earnings conference call this past week.
The call came from the REIT’s largest shareholder, Charles P. Fitzgerald, senior managing member and general partner of V3 Capital Management LP, a New York-based investment advisory firm. V3 holds more than...
item.author: Mark Heschmeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: New Wave of Retail Tenants Filling Power Centers
item.description:
During the recession, hundreds of retail power center tenants went dark, putting millions of square feet of vacant space back on the market. Store chains like Circuit City, Borders and Mervyns went bankrupt, while others such as Best Buy and Linens N Things, sharply reduced their number of stores, leaving vacant holes in many shopping centers.
Power centers, unenclosed retail centers ranging in size from 250,000 square feet to 750,000 square feet...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Once Left for Dead, Suburban Office Making a Comeback
item.description: About three-quarters of all U.S. office space is located outside the city center in low-rise and medium-rise properties in suburban business centers across the country. During the Great Recession and its aftermath, suburban office markets took an outsized hit. Some analysts wrote the obituary of the suburban office campus as downsizing companies shed millions of square feet, in many cases consolidating into buildings closer to public transit in...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Inland Real Estate Partners With Australian Firm to Develop Grocery-Anchored Retail
item.description:
Inland Real Estate Corp. (NYSE:IRC) announced it has formed a joint venture with an affiliate of Melbourne, Australia-based MAB Corp.to develop grocery-anchored shopping centers in markets throughout the southeastern U.S.
The five-year development program with MAB American Retail Partners, LLC will target metros in the Carolinas, Georgia, Florida, Virginia and Washington, D.C. and could result in the construction of as many as 20 new grocery-anchored...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Online Game Maker Leases 284,000 SF in West LA
item.description:
Riot Games, Inc., maker of the popular League of Legends online game, has signed a full building lease for the entire 284,037-square-foot Element: LA office campus located at the corner of S. Bundy Dr. and W. Olympic Blvd. in Los Angeles.
The five-building campus is located in West Los Angeles and includes a five-story parking garage. The property is currently undergoing renovation and redevelopment by owner Hudson Pacific Properties.
"Riot...
item.author: Justin Sumner <news@costar.com>

item.title: Prominent Core Asset Nashville City Center Trades Hands for $103 Million
item.description:
Closely following Highwoods Properties' $152.8 million acquisition of Pinnacle at Symphony Place in September, another out-of-town investor has purchased a prominent office property in downtown Nashille. Alliance Partners HSP LLC, a Philadelphia-based affiliate of Honolulu, Hawaii-based The Shidler Group, bought the 27-story Nashville City Center at 511 Union St. for $103 million.
Parmenter Realty Partners, a real estate investment, management...
item.author: Jordan Kellermeyer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Ivanhoé Cambridge, DivcoWest, TPG Venture Buys San Jose Office Portfolio
item.description:
Investors can’t seem to get enough Silicon Valley office real estate. In the latest big acquisition, MWest Properties, a joint venture formed by DivcoWest, Ivanhoé Cambridge and TPG Real Estate, has acquired a three-campus office portfolio in North San Jose, CA from Carr Properties.
The acquisition for a reported $200 million includes 12 R&D and corporate office buildings totaling 825,000 square feet. Major tenants in the buildings include Boston...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>

item.title: Kite Realty Buying $307 Million Retail Portfolio
item.description:
Kite Realty Group Trust (NYSE: KRG) is significantly expanding its retail property portfolio in four states with a deal to acquire nine properties totaling approximately two million square feet for $307 million in cash.
The Indianapolis-based retail REIT is funding the purchase through net proceeds from a common share offering as well as cash on hand, the expected proceeds from the sale of two retail properties Kite is currently marketing for sale...
item.author: Bryce Meyers <news@costar.com>

item.title: Griffin Capital Acquires 18-Property Office Portfolio for $521.5M
item.description:
Griffin Capital Corp. has acquired an 18-property office portfolio totaling 4 million square feet spread across 12 markets in 11 states for $521.5 million.
The El Segundo, CA-based privately held real estate investment firm acquired the predominantly single-tenant office portfolio, triple-net leased portfolio from Atlanta-based Columbia Property Trust on behalf of Griffin Capital Essential Asset REIT, a non-traded real estate investment trust.
Key...
item.author: Randyl Drummer <news@costar.com>
